subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unit test java documentation
msgSnippet: Or, as Kent is also known for saying, What drugs were you on when you thought *that* was a good idea?! [Just humor, folks. Hold your cards and letters.] ...
messageBody:
Or, as Kent is also known for saying, "What drugs were you on when you thought *that* was a good idea?!"

[Just humor, folks. Hold your cards and letters.]

>So said Bob Koss on 2003-07-02 --------------------
>
>Or, as Kent is known for saying, "Doctor, it hurts when I do this."
>
>
>On 7/2/03 3:46 AM, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@...> wrote:
>
>> icepickorama wrote:
>>> Each one of my test methods is in turn comprised of multiple
>>> tests (for example you may have a method called
>>> testVectorAdd, but this is composed of multiple positive and
>>> negative tests). Therefore the tests names aren't sufficient
>>> and only give a fairly high-level overview of what's being tested.
>>
>> Then why are you doing this? Why aren't you writing smaller, more
>> focused test methods???
>>
>> If your methods are testing so much, doesn't it become harder to tell
>> why a test failed?
>>
>> Curious, Ilja
>>
>>
>>
